statement: A police department issues 65 tickets each day for 34 days. How many tickets did they issue in total?
A windmill generates 8086 kilowatts of electricity every day. How much electricity will it generate in 7 days?
If the windmill generated 5447 kilowatts of electricity daily instead of 8086 kilowatts, how much electricity would it generate in 7 days?
A company produces 55 tubes of toothpaste every hour for 35 hours. How many tubes of toothpaste did they produce?

Instead of producing toothpaste for 35 hours, the company decided to increase their production time to 316 hours, still producing 55 tubes of toothpaste every hour. How many tubes of toothpaste did they produce now?
A company produces 96 unique keys per day for 83 days. How many keys in total did they produce?
Considering the previous problem, if the company instead produced 993 unique keys per day for the same period of 96 days, how many keys in total would they have produced?
A company produces 9212 balls of a specific type every day for 9 consecutive days. How many balls did they produce overall?
Suppose instead the company had been producing only 3032 balls of a specific type each day for the same 9 consecutive days. How many balls would they have produced in this case?
A school bus can carry 6353 students. If there is only 1 bus available, how many students can it carry?
Now, imagine if the school bus could only carry 229 students instead of 6353. How many students can this bus carry?
A pirate ship has 76 cannons, each firing 45 cannonballs in a battle. How many cannonballs does the pirate ship fire in total?

Considering the same pirate ship, what if instead of firing 45 cannonballs per cannon, each of the 76 cannons fired 708 cannonballs in a battle? How many cannonballs does the pirate ship fire in total now?
A bus can carry 5244 passengers. How many passengers can 5 buses carry in total?
Following from the previous problem, imagine instead that each bus can carry 8347 passengers. How many passengers can 5 buses carry in total now?
A friend of yours has been saving money for 2 years. Every year, they manage to save $2008. How much money have they saved in total?

In response to the previous situation with your friend, imagine instead that they were able to save just $125 every year for those same 2 years. How much would they have managed to save under these circumstances?
A chocolate factory produces 4916 chocolate bars every hour for 4 hours. How many chocolate bars did they produce?
If the chocolate factory mentioned before actually produced 7489 chocolate bars every hour for the same 4 hours, how many chocolate bars did they produce instead?
A pirate found a hidden treasure, which contains 91 chests, each chest holding 55 gold coins. How many gold coins did the pirate find in total?
Instead of 91 chests, suppose the pirate found 1489 chests, each still holding 55 gold coins. How many gold coins did the pirate find in total now?
A farmer grows 50 bunches of grapes and each bunch has 12 grapes each. How many grapes did the farmer grow in total?
If instead of 50 bunches of grapes, the farmer had 6804 bunches of grapes, each with 12 grapes, how many grapes did the farmer grow in total?
A helicopter can carry 64 pounds every minute. If it works continuously for 75 minutes, how many pounds can the helicopter carry?
If the helicopter could actually carry 1063 pounds every minute instead of 64, how many pounds would it be able to carry in 75 minutes?
A piano manufacturer produces 4750 pianos every week for 7 weeks. How many pianos have they produced in total?
Suppose the piano manufacturer had actually produced 1339 pianos every week instead of 4750 pianos for the same 7 weeks. How many pianos would they have produced then?
A snow machine produces 8873 snowballs every hour for 8 hours. How many snowballs did it produce?
The snow machine went into maintenance for a few hours, after which it could only produce 93 snowballs per hour, still for 8 hours. How many snowballs did it produce after maintenance?
A certain type of rope is produced in 84 equal strands, each measuring 75 meters long. How many meters of rope are produced in total?

Considering the previous scenario, let's say the machinery was recalibrated and now each of the 84 strands of rope are now 742 meters long instead of 75 meters. How long is the total length of all strands now?
A doctor treats 5837 patients each day for 8 days. How many patients has the doctor treated?

In the previous scenario, the doctor treated 5837 patients for 8 days. Now, imagine that instead the doctor treated 7467 patients each day for the same period of 8 days. How many patients has the doctor treated now?
A tree farmer plants 4749 trees each day over 6 days. How many trees did he plant in total?
In the previous scenario with the tree farmer, suppose he has instead planted 4511 trees each day over the same 6 days. How many trees did he plant in total now?
A florist has 80 vases, each filled with 64 flowers. How many flowers are there in all the vases?
Suppose now that each vase is filled with 891 flowers instead of 64 flowers. How many flowers are there in all the vases now?
A quilt maker uses 4932 pieces of cloth to make one blanket. How many pieces of cloth did he/she use?
Consider the quilt maker decided to create a larger blanket this time, needing a total of 7404 pieces of cloth. How many pieces of cloth would he/she have used in this case?
A pillow maker produces 40 pillows every hour for 17 hours. How many pillows did they make?
In the previous scenario, if the pillow maker increased their production rate to 460 pillows every hour while still working for the same 40 hours, how many pillows would they make then?
A monkey picks 9434 bananas each day for 7 days. How many bananas has the monkey picked in total?
If the same Monkey instead picked 2926 bananas each day for a week, how many bananas would it have picked in total?
A ballerina performs 64 pirouettes each day for 21 days. How many pirouettes has she performed overall?
Suppose the ballerina decided to increase her pirouettes and performed 3075 pirouettes each day for the same 21 days. How many pirouettes has she performed now?
A school bus transports 28 students to school every day for 12 days. How many students total have been transported?
Suppose the school bus capacity was increased and it could now transport 8194 students to school every day. What would be the total number of students transported to school in 12 days?
A facility produces 78 balls per day for 22 days. How many balls do they produce in total?
Now, imagine the facility didn't produce 78 balls per day, but massively increased production to 3263 balls per day over the same period of 22 days. How many balls do they produce in total now?
A glasses manufacturer produces 64 glasses per batch, and they managed to produce 22 batches in one day. How many glasses did they produce in a day?

The glasses manufacturer decided to upgrade their production line, and now they are able to produce 821 glasses per batch while still maintaining 22 batches per day. How many glasses are they now able to produce in one day?
A city bus has a regular route that is 2836 km long. If the bus travels the route 5 times, how many kilometers does it cover?
Suppose the length of the city bus route changes to 8724 km. If the bus still travels this new route 5 times, how many kilometers does it cover now?
A pizza restaurant sells 1959 pizzas each day for a period of 4 consecutive days. How many pizzas did they sell altogether?
Suppose the pizza restaurant's sales decreased and they sold 772 pizzas each day instead of 1959 for a period of 4 consecutive days. How many pizzas did they sell in these 4 days?
A mouse eats 85 grains of rice per day for 93 days. How many grains of rice does the mouse eat in total?
In the previous scenario, consider that the mouse eats 625 grains of rice per day instead of 85. How many grains of rice does the mouse eat in total in the 93 days?
A building has 83 floors, and each floor has 18 windows. How many windows are there in the entire building?
Suppose the building instead had 4633 floors, each with the same number of 18 windows. How many windows would there be in the entire building now?
A toothpaste company produced 2917 tubes for 3 consecutive days. How many toothpaste tubes did they produce in total?
The toothpaste company changed their production and now produces 1576 tubes for 3 consecutive days. How many toothpaste tubes do they now produce in total?
A student has 90 eraser packs, each containing 81 erasers. How many erasers does the student have in total?
Suppose the student's eraser pack size changes, and instead of carrying 90 packs, they now carry 584 packs, each still containing 81 erasers. How many erasers does the student have now?
A baker creates 2 cakes, each requiring 2585 grams of flour. How many grams of flour does the baker need in total?

In the previous problem, a baker created 2 cakes, each requiring 2585 grams of flour. But now, let's say the baker decides to use a new recipe that requires 6073 grams of flour per cake instead. How many grams of flour does the baker need to make 2 cakes using the new recipe?
A jewelry maker designs 3 necklaces, each with 7303 beads. How many total beads did they use for the necklaces?
Instead of using 7303 beads per necklace, the jewelry maker decides to use 9719 beads for each of the 3 necklaces. How many total beads did they use for the necklaces this time?
A fisherman catches 30 fish each day for 16 days. How many fish has he caught in total?
If the fisherman instead catches 2193 fish each day for the same 30 days, how many fish would he have caught in total?
A paint manufacturer produces 6 batches of paint, each containing 1868 liters. How many liters in total did they produce?
The paint manufacturer decides to reduce the size of each batch to 437 liters, but still produces 6 batches. How many liters in total did they produce now?
A forest contains 74 trees and each tree produces 10 kilograms of fruits. How many kilograms of fruits does the forest produce?
In the same forest, there are 5619 trees each producing 10 kilograms of fruits. How many kilograms of fruits do these trees produce?
A farmer manages to grow 41 carrots in each of his 21 vegetable patches. How many carrots does the farmer have in total?
The farmer has now evolved his farming techniques and grown a record-breaking 1194 carrots from each of his 41 vegetable patches. How many carrots does he have now?
A drum manufacturer produces 3070 drums per day for 7 days. How many drums are produced in total?
Suppose the drum manufacturer changes its production strategy and starts producing 2161 drums per day for 7 days instead of the 3070 drums per day. How many drums are now produced in total?
A toothbrush company produces 2949 toothbrushes every hour for 6 hours. How many toothbrushes did they produce in that time?
The toothbrush company decided to increase its production rate. So now, they produce 6645 toothbrushes every hour for the same 6 hours frame. How many toothbrushes do they produce now in that time?
A farm produces 8938 liters of milk every day for 4 days. How many liters of milk did the farm produce?
If the farm previously mentioned reduced its daily milk production to 2776 liter a day, but still maintained that production for 4 days. How many liters of milk would the farm produce now?
A puzzle creator designed 2588 puzzles each year for 9 years. How many puzzles did he design in total?
The puzzle creator decided to slightly increase his productivity and designed 2704 puzzles each year instead of 2588. How many puzzles did he design over the same 9-year period with this new rate?
A person gives 2 gifts, each worth 9797 dollars. What is the total cost of the gifts?
The person decided to give 2 other gifts, each worth 6151 dollars instead of 9797 dollars. What is the total cost of these other gifts?
In a video game, a player collects 1 diamond worth 6338 points. How many points has the player collected from diamonds?
In the same video game, consider that the player collects 1 diamond, but in this level, the diamond is worth only 166 points. How many points does the player collect from this diamond?
A sock company packages 81 pairs of socks in one box. If they made 98 boxes, how many pairs of socks did they make?
Now consider if the sock company were to package 645 pairs of socks in one box instead. If they made 98 boxes again, how many pairs of socks would they make then?
A telescope magnifies an object 67 times and each magnification adds 86 units to the object's size. What is the total size of the object with added magnification?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 67]]
[[var b = 86]]
[[var c = a * b]]
[[question d = ['c']]]

statement: The original object size under the telescope was 58 units instead of 86. If the telescope still magnifies the object 67 times, what would be the total size of the object now?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 67]]
[[var b = 58]]
[[var c = a * b]]
[[question d = ['c']]]

statement: A computer company produces 1010 computer units every day over a period of 7 days. How many computer units have they manufactured in total?
If the computer company was instead able to produce 8413 computer units each day over the same period of 7 days, how many units have they manufactured in total now?
A musician writes a song that lasts 9888 seconds. If it is played back-to-back twice, how many seconds does it last in total?
If that musician decides to write a new song that lasts 3435 seconds and it is also played back-to-back twice, how many seconds will this new song last in total?
A crayon factory produces 4 boxes of crayons, each containing 4535 crayons. How many crayons have they produced in total?
The crayon factory has increased its output. Now, it produces 4 boxes of crayons, each containing 7780 crayons. How many crayons does the factory produce with this increased output?
A backpack brand produces 4563 bags daily for a week. How many backpacks do they produce in total?
If the same backpack brand instead produces 9981 bags daily for a week, how many backpacks would they produce in total?
A roller skate company makes 95 pairs of roller skates every hour, for 17 hours a day. How many pairs of roller skates do they make in a day?
Now, consider the roller skate company now makes 3137 pairs of roller skates every hour instead of 95. How many pairs of roller skates do they make in a day?
A chair designer uses 97 pieces of wood for each chair and designs 97 chairs. How many pieces of wood are used in total?
After the first batch of chairs, the chair designer decides to use 269 pieces of wood for each chair but still designs 97 chairs. How many pieces of wood are used this time?
A sports store sells 20 pairs of ice skates per day, each priced at $99. Determine the total revenue in one day?

A sports store originally thought they sold 20 pairs of ice skates per day, each priced at $99. But then, they realized that they actually sold 943 pairs of ice skates per day. Determine the total revenue of the sports store in one day considering the updated quantity of sold ice skates?
A zookeeper is tasked with feeding 73 flamingos. Each flamingo eats 10 shrimp every day. How many shrimp does the zookeeper need to feed all the flamingos for one day?

Suppose instead of 73 flamingos, the zookeeper had to feed 4695 flamingos. Each flamingo still eats 10 shrimp every day. How many shrimp would the zookeeper need to feed all the flamingos for one day?
A beach ball factory produces 83 beach balls each hour for 89 hours. How many beach balls have they made?
The beach ball factory's production increases and they now produce 566 beach balls each hour for 89 hours. How many beach balls have they now made?
A marine biologist finds 91 groups of starfish, each group containing 36 starfish. How many starfish did they find in total?

The marine biologist initially mistook some other marine creatures for starfish. After careful examination, she found that there were actually 2771 groups of starfish, not 91. Each group still contained 36 starfish. How many starfish were there really?
A community builds 37 jungle gyms, each one requiring 74 pieces. How many total pieces are used to build all the jungle gyms?
Suppose instead of requiring 74 pieces, each jungle gym requires 579 pieces. How many total pieces are now used to build all 37 jungle gyms?
A phone manufacturing company produces 9978 phones every hour for 9 hours. How many phones have they produced?
If the phone manufacturing company instead produces 3458 phones every hour for 9 hours, how many phones have they produced now?
A Princess owns 16 dresses, each with 72 sequins. How many sequins does the Princess have in total on all her dresses?

In the original estimation, it was mistakenly counted that the Princess owns 16 dresses. In reality, she owns 1016 dresses, each with 72 sequins. How many sequins does the Princess have in total on all her dresses now?
A shoe factory makes 5227 shoes every day for 8 days. How many shoes have they made?
Suppose the shoe factory instead made 2311 shoes each day for the same 8 days. How many shoes would they have made then?
A cheese factory produces 7975 kilograms of cheese every day for 4 days. How many kilograms of cheese have they produced?
If the cheese factory actually produced 4145 kilograms of cheese each day instead of 7975 kilograms, how many kilograms of cheese would they have produced in 4 days?
In a sandbox, there are 8061 grains of sand in each of 9 piles. How many grains of sand are there in total?
If instead, there were 9553 grains of sand in each of the 9 piles in the sandbox, how many grains of sand would there be in total now?
A police station receives 20 emergency calls every day. If this continues for 93 days, how many emergency calls will they have received in total?
The police station adjusted its data and found out that they actually receive 20 emergency calls every day for 2675 days. How many emergency calls will they have received given this new information?
A baby says 6569 words in a day for 8 days. How many words does the baby say in total?
If the baby instead said 6695 words per day for the same 8 days, how many words does the baby say in total now?
On an ice island, each day a penguin lays 48 eggs for 54 days. How many eggs does the penguin lay in total?
A hat maker has crafted 9 unique hats, each with a special design consisting of 3084 stitches. How many stitches are there in total across all hats?
Suppose the hat maker instead crafted 9 unique hats, each with a more complex design consisting of 9163 stitches. How many stitches would be there in total across all hats in this scenario?
A certain breed of cat has an average of 3393 strands of fur. If you have one of these cats, how many strands of fur does it have?
Suppose instead of the previous breed, you have a different breed of cat that has an average of 5245 strands of fur. If you have one of these cats, how many strands of fur does it have?
A bakery makes 2 cakes, each with 2873 calories. How many calories are there in total?
If instead, the bakery made 2 cakes, each with 5243 calories, how many calories would there be in total now?
A sleeping bag manufacturing company produces 9266 sleeping bags every day for 9 days. How many sleeping bags did they produce?
What if the sleeping bag manufacturing company instead produced 8567 sleeping bags every day for the same 9 days? How many sleeping bags would they produce then?
A candy factory produces 3108 candies every hour for 5 hours. How many candies have they produced?
A candy factory decides to increase their output and now produces 7880 candies every hour for 5 hours. How many candies have they produced now?
A group of children builds 5 snowmen with each snowman containing 4016 snowballs. How many snowballs have they used in total?
What would be the total number of snowballs used if the group of children only built each snowman with 174 snowballs instead of 4016?
A dairy farmer fills up 88 bottles of milk each day, with each bottle containing 46 liters of milk. How many liters of milk does he fill up in a day?

Suppose the dairy farmer decides to increase his production and now fills up 2110 bottles of milk each day, with each bottle containing 46 liters of milk. How many liters of milk does he fill up in a day now?
A river flows at a rate of 9441 litres per second. What would be the total amount of water, in litres, that it would discharge into the sea in 9 seconds?

If the river, instead of flowing at a rate of 9441 litres per second, flowed at a rate of 4184 litres per second, what would be the total amount of water, in litres, that it would discharge into the sea in 9 seconds?
A balloon factory creates 4238 balloons every day for 8 days straight. How many balloons did they create?
If the balloon factory only managed to produce 97 balloons every day instead of 4238, over the same span of 8 days, how many balloons would they have created?
An ice cream factory produces 59 batches of ice cream every day for 26 days. How many total batches of ice cream have they produced?

The factory decides to increase its efficiency and starts producing 656 batches of ice cream every day instead of 59, still over 26 days. How many total batches of ice cream have they now produced for that period?
A fish breeder has 86 tanks and each tank has 91 fish. How many fish does the breeder have in total?
Instead of 91 fish in each tank, the breeder puts 581 fish in each of the 86 tanks. How many fish does the breeder have now?
A car factory produces 42 cars every hour for 21 hours. How many cars were produced in total?

After the initial 21 hours of production, the car factory boosts its production and starts producing 1204 cars every hour for 42 hours. How many cars were produced during this increased production period?
A library has 53 shelves and each shelf has 63 books. How many books are there in the library?
The library decides to add more books to each shelf. Now, each of the 581 shelves has 63 books. How many books are there in the library now?

A scientist measures a rainbow's intensity and finds out that the intensity increases by 6890 units for each color seen. If there are 8 colors appearing, what is the total increase in intensity of the rainbow?

The scientist makes a revision to his measurements and now believes that the intensity of the rainbow actually increases by 4301 units for each color seen. If there are the same 8 colors appearing, what is the total increase in intensity of the rainbow now?
A friend is carefully scanning photos into their computer. They manage to scan 3173 photos every day for 9 days. How many photos have they scanned in total?
After scanning the initial batch, your friend continues their project and manages to scan 8149 photos every day for the next 9 days. How many additional photos have they managed to scan?
A gardener plants 33 flowers, each taking 60 minutes to plant. How many minutes will the gardener take to plant all the flowers?
The gardener decides to plant more flowers. This time, he plants 1523 flowers, each still taking 60 minutes to plant. How many minutes will it take the gardener to plant all these new flowers?
A dressmaker creates skirts, each skirt uses 94 inches of fabric. If the dressmaker creates 12 skirts, how many inches of fabric does she use?
An alien fleet dispatches 18 UFOs to Earth, each carrying 22 extraterrestrials aboard. How many aliens have they sent to Earth?
Now imagine that instead of carrying 22 extraterrestrials, each UFO carries 1066 aliens. How many aliens would they then have sent to Earth?
A kite maker produces 3 types of kites, each type has 8497 pieces. How many pieces do they have in total?

In the previous problem, we discussed a kite maker who produces 3 types of kites, each type having 8497 pieces. Now, let's consider a different scenario where each type of kite has 4425 pieces instead. So, how many pieces would they have in total in this new scenario?
A teddy bear factory makes 23 teddy bears every hour. If the factory operates for 63 hours, how many teddy bears are made?
A pirate has a treasure map that shows 90 pieces of gold hidden for each of the 31 days in a month. How many pieces of gold does the map indicate in total for that month?
A table making company has received an order to make 92 tables every day for 28 days. How many tables will they end up making?

After making 92 tables every day for 28 days, the table making company received another order. This time, they need to make 843 tables per day for the next 92 days. How many tables will they make in this period?
A fireplace burns 7905 logs every week for 4 weeks. How many logs did it burn?
If instead of burning 7905 logs every week for 4 weeks, the fireplace had burned 8373 logs per week for the same duration, how many logs would it have burned?
A toothpaste factory produces 7837 tubes of toothpaste every hour. If the factory operates for 9 hours, how many tubes of toothpaste do they produce?
If the toothpaste factory instead produced 291 tubes of toothpaste every hour, how many would they produce if they still operated for 9 hours?
A farmer harvests 3799 cucumbers from each of his 3 fields. How many cucumbers does he harvest in total?
The farmer realized he made a mistake and only harvested 550 cucumbers from each of his 3 fields. How many cucumbers did he actually harvest in total?
In a zoo, each of the 84 enclosures has 48 animals. How many animals are there in total in all the enclosures?
In the same zoo, consider a scenario where each of the 84 enclosures instead housed 511 animals. In light of this change, how many animals would there be in total across all enclosures?
A farmer harvested 43 bundles of carrots, each bundle contains 40 carrots.  How many carrots did the farmer harvest in total?
A dragon breathes fire and burns 4618 trees in a forest each day for 3 days. How many trees in total did the dragon burn in these three days?
Considering that the dragon instead burned 2302 trees each day for the same 3 days, how many trees in total did the dragon burn in these three days?
There is a mountain that is 3618 meters tall. How many meters tall is a mountain that is exactly 1 times the height of the first mountain?
There is a second mountain that is 3488 meters tall. How many meters tall is a mountain that is exactly 1 times the height of this second mountain?
A cloud formation occupies an area of 18 miles by 18 miles. What is the total number of square miles occupied by the cloud formation?

Instead of having an area of 18 miles by 18 miles, what if the cloud formation now occupies an area of 18 miles by 2898 miles. What is the total number of square miles occupied by the cloud formation now?
A grape farm produces 60 clusters of grapes every day, with each cluster containing 64 grapes. How many grapes does the farm produce in a day?
A helicopter builder needs 3224 parts for each helicopter. If they plan to build 4 helicopters, how many parts will they need in total?
Suppose the helicopter builder now needs 7661 parts for each helicopter, instead of 3224 as originally planned. If they still plan to build 4 helicopters, how many parts will they need in total now?
A jacket factory produces 3425 jackets each day for two days. How many jackets have they produced?
Now suppose the jacket factory instead produces 2079 jackets each day for two days. How many jackets have they produced now?
A towel factory produces 1380 towels every day for 9 days. How many towels have they produced?
Suppose the towel factory increased its production and now makes 7978 towels every day for the same 9 days. How many towels have they produced now?
A manufacturer makes 1 pair of binoculars per day which they sell for 7743 dollars each. How much does the manufacturer make in a day from binoculars?
What if the manufacturer decides to reduce the price and sell the binoculars for 7302 dollars each instead? How much would they make per day then?
